connection_failed.title: Evon Smart Home connection failed
connection_failed.description:
The integration has failed to connect to your Evon Smart Home system {failures} times in a row.

Last error: {error}

Please check:
- Your Evon system is powered on and connected to the network
- The host URL in the integration configuration is correct
- Your network allows connections to the Evon system

The integration will automatically recover when the connection is restored.

confirm.title: Stale entities were removed

config_migration_failed.title: Evon configuration migration failed
config_migration_failed.description:
Your Evon Smart Home configuration was created with a newer version of the integration (version {current_version}) and cannot be used with the current version (supports up to version {supported_version}).

Please update the Evon Smart Home integration to the latest version, or remove and re-add the integration.

user.description: Choose how to connect to your Evon Smart Home system.

data_description.connection_type: **Local network** is recommended for faster response times and better reliability. Use **Remote access** only when connecting from outside your home network.

local.title: Local Network Connection
local.description: Enter your Evon Smart Home local connection details. You can find the IP address in your router or the Evon system settings.

remote.title: Remote Access Connection
remote.description: Enter your Evon Smart Home remote access credentials. The Engine ID can be found in your Evon system settings or documentation.

data_description.sync_areas: Automatically assign devices to Home Assistant areas based on their room assignment in the Evon system. Note: Changing this option will reload the integration.
data_description.non_dimmable_lights: Select lights that should be treated as on/off only (no dimming). Useful for LED strips connected via PWM dimmers that need full power. Note: Changing this option will reload the integration.
